Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black with two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of foreleg of sphinx, to left; elaborate rosette and rising lozenge as filling ornament; below, two brown lines.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p. 14, no. 18, pl. 3)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 266, no. 601, pl. 75)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0595) (phase 2)
